questions.question_text: Which of the following use the same non-keyed form factor to interface peripherals to a computer? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: "Keyed" to prevents insertion of a card connector (male) to an incompatible socket (female) on the host like with RAM slots and modules... so "nonkeyed" is essentially reversible = USB-C and Thunderbolt

choices.D: Reapply thermal paste to the CPU.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The OS can not be found, it is on the SSD or HD, so you should check this
When your computer tells you the boot device is not found, this means it can't find the hard drive containing the instructions for loading your operating system.

comments.content: This is absolutely wrong. If the RAM needed to be reseated, the POST wouldn't finish and the system would beep. The technician accidently brushed the HDD cable and caused it to become loose or something of that degree.

discussion.content: the only reason it's reseating the memory instead of the cable it's because the technician upgraded the ram. Since the tech touch the ram it's likely that's what caused it since you can prob replace the ram without disconnecting the HDD

Selected Answer: B
It's wrong the correct answer is : B

questions.question_text:
A technician is upgrading the memory in a workstation. While the case is open, the technician cleans out all the dust that has accumulated around the components. The technician installs the memory and then attempts to boot the system, but the system gets stuck while displaying the following message:

Boot media not found -
Which of the following will MOST likely fix the issue and allow the system to boot properly?
Which of the following uses NFC to complete financial transactions?

A technician is setting up a multifunction printer in an enterprise. Users of this device regularly print documents containing PII. Which of the following settings has the GREATEST security implications for the technician to consider?

choices.D: Enable file and printer sharing in the OS.
choices.A: Ensure the options are configured to provide a DNS server.
choices.C: Configure the wireless network's SSID to be hidden.
choices.B: Verify the Windows Firewall is turned off.

questions.question_text:
A technician is setting up a new wireless network at a branch office that previously had only wired connectivity with statically assigned IP addresses. After setting up the network, the technician configures a server to provide IP addresses to wireless clients. During testing, the technician is unable to access the Internet or named network resources. The technician receives a valid IP address from the DHCP server and can ping the default gateway.
Which of the following should be technician check NEXT to resolve this issue?

comments.content: To add to this, when ever you see something like "the technician is unable to access the Internet", you should automatically assume DNS if its provided as an option.

discussion.content:
DNS is the most correct answer because local networks can use hostnames to find each other.
Windows Firewall would not prevent an Internet connection.
The visibility of the SSID is not relevant.
Enabling file/printer sharing would not resolve Internet connectivity.
Key words = unable to access the Internet or named network resources = DNS
